citation.title: A comet model. I. The acceleration of Comet Encke

wikipedia.title: Comet
wikipedia.summary: A comet is an icy small Solar System body that, when passing close to the Sun, heats up and begins to outgas, displaying a visible atmosphere or coma, and sometimes also a tail.

wikipedia.title: Komet
wikipedia.summary: En komet r en mindre himlakropp som kretsar runt solen. Nr den befinner sig tillrckligt nra solen framtrder en synlig koma (atmosfr) eller en svans vilka bda frmst uppstr p grund av effekten frn solstrlning p kometkrnan.

wikipedia.title: Fred Lawrence Whipple
wikipedia.summary: Fred Lawrence Whipple (November 5, 1906 – August 30, 2004) was an American astronomer, who worked at the Harvard College Observatory for over 70 years.

wikipedia.title: Observational history of comets
wikipedia.summary: In the first book of his Meteorology, Aristotle propounded the view of comets that would hold sway in Western thought for nearly two thousand years.

news.title: Rosetta scientists unveil the source of ice and dust jets on comet 67P
news.summary: After a decade-long journey through space, the Rosetta spacecraft has spent the past year less than 100km from the nucleus of comet 67P Churyumov-Gerasimenko, capturing some stunningly detailed images.

policy.title: Exploring Organic Environments in the Solar System

source.name: National Academies Press
source.description: The US National Academies Press (NAP) was created by the National Academy of Sciences to publish the reports of the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine, operating under a charter granted by the Congress of the United States. The NAP publishes on a wide range of topics in science, engineering, and medicine, providing authoritative information on important matters in science and health policy.
